page.title: 01Curdridge Village.
page.content: Curdridge is a small village situated on the B3035 between Botley and Bishops Waltham. The population is approximately 1,400. Some of the land is used for housing, but most of it is agricultural. Curdridge has Scout, Guide, Cub and Brownie packs, a Dramatic Group, W.I. and Toddler Group. There are two Public Houses, The Cricketers Inn and Railway Inn. There is a Post Office and Village Stores, and a produce shop. There is also a garage with a shop. There is a large Y.M.C.A. Centre, Fairthorne Manor, which has such facilities as canoeing and rock-climbing. There are two old people's homes, the White House and Kitnocks House. The other buildings of interest in the village are the Reading Room, St. Peter's Church and the School.
